title: World War II Valor in the Pacific National Monument: Park Home
body: From Engagement to Peace  At World War II Valor in the Pacific National Monument, home of the USS Arizona Memorial, learn about one of the most pivotal moments in US history: the attack on Pearl Harbor, and the subsequent entry of the United States into World War II. The monument preserves and interprets the stories of the Pacific War, from the internment of Japanese Americans to the battles in the Aleutians.              Visiting the USS Arizona Memorial   Here you'll find the answers to the most common questions we get about visiting the USS Arizona Memorial.            Submit Your Video To Our Competition!    Are you a high school or college student? Create a video telling your familyâ€™s Pacific War story and submit it to our Acts of Valor project!        Research Dives at the USS Arizona   Follow along with Jessica Keller, NPS archeologist and diver, as she helps conduct research on the structure of the USS Arizona this August!              Multimedia   Here you'll find historical and current photos, videos, audio recordings, and more.        Special Events at the Monument   Take a look at our calendar to see what events we have coming up!        Bring Your Class to the Memorial   Find out about educational opportunities here at the monument, including how to plan a field trip to the USS Arizona Memorial.
